intro: Aethusa leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typically narrow and elongated. This plant is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is an annual herb that thrives in sunny conditions and is known for its rapid growth cycle. The plant's botanical features make it a common sight in meadows and along roadsides.
